episodeTitle: Roger and Rayleigh - The King of the Pirates and His Right Hand Man
episodeTitleJapanese: ロジャーとレイリー　海賊王とその右腕
episodeTitleRomanized: Rojā to Reirī - Kaizoku Ō to sono Migiude
description: At Shakky's bar, Rayleigh reveals his past as Gol D. Roger's first mate and the truth about the Pirate King's final journey. Robin asks about the Void Century, but chooses to discover the truth herself. Meanwhile, Admiral Kizaru arrives at Sabaody Archipelago.

events.title: Kizaru's Dramatic Arrival at Sabaody
events.description: Admiral Kizaru arrives at Sabaody Archipelago by riding atop a cannonball, landing in Grove 27 with a frightening explosion that terrifies nearby pirates. He announces his presence to Marine Headquarters via his wrist Den Den Mushi.
events.significance: This marks Kizaru's formal introduction to the Sabaody Arc and signals the Marines' response to the Celestial Dragon incident, escalating the threat level for all pirates on the island.

events.title: Rayleigh Reveals His Identity as Roger's First Mate
events.description: At Shakky's bar, Silvers Rayleigh reveals to the Straw Hat Pirates that he served as the vice-captain and first mate of the legendary Gol D. Roger's crew, the Roger Pirates.
events.significance: This revelation connects the Straw Hats directly to the Pirate King's legacy and establishes Rayleigh as one of the most important historical figures in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: I was the vice-captain and first mate of the Roger Pirates.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh reveals his past to the Straw Hats

events.title: Roger's Illness and Voluntary Surrender
events.description: Rayleigh reveals that Gol D. Roger was never captured by the Marines. Instead, Roger contracted an incurable disease four years before his execution and voluntarily turned himself in one year after disbanding his crew.
events.significance: This revelation completely rewrites the official story of Roger's capture and execution, showing that Roger orchestrated his own death to spark the Great Pirate Era.

quotes.text: Roger was never captured. He turned himself in.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh reveals the truth about Roger's surrender

events.title: Crocus Joins Roger's Final Journey
events.description: Rayleigh explains that when Roger's crew reached the Twin Capes at the entrance to the Grand Line, they encountered Crocus, the lighthouse keeper. Roger asked Crocus to join them as the ship's doctor to help manage his incurable disease during his final voyage.
events.significance: This reveals Crocus's connection to the Pirate King and explains why he was at Twin Capes. It also shows that Roger knew he was dying when he began his final journey to conquer the Grand Line.

events.title: Shanks and Buggy Confirmed as Roger Pirates Apprentices
events.description: Rayleigh confirms that both Shanks and Buggy served as apprentices aboard the Oro Jackson, Roger's ship. He mentions that Shanks met him ten years ago and told him about a boy in East Blue who said the same things as their captain.
events.significance: This officially confirms Shanks and Buggy's connection to the Pirate King and reveals that Shanks has been aware of Luffy's potential connection to Roger's will since their first meeting.

quotes.text: He told me about a kid in East Blue who said the same things as our captain.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh recounts Shanks telling him about Luffy

events.title: The Great Pirate Era's True Origin
events.description: Rayleigh explains that after conquering the Grand Line, Roger disbanded his crew and voluntarily turned himself in to the Marines. The Marines made a public spectacle of his execution, but Roger's final words sparked what became known as the Great Pirate Era.
events.significance: This reveals that Roger intentionally created the Great Pirate Era through his execution speech, fundamentally shaping the world of One Piece and inspiring countless pirates including Luffy.

quotes.text: Roger loved flashy things. That's why he enjoyed his title as Pirate King, even though it was meaningless since he was about to die.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

events.title: Robin Asks About the Void Century
events.description: Robin reveals to Rayleigh that she found a Poneglyph in Skypiea with a message from Gol D. Roger, then asks if he knows about the Void Century. Rayleigh confirms that the Roger Pirates learned everything about the Void Century, the Ancient Weapons, and the meaning of the Will of D.
events.significance: This is the first confirmation that someone alive knows the complete truth about the Void Century, raising the stakes for Robin's quest and the overall mystery of the series.

quotes.text: Yes, we know. We learned everything.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh confirms the Roger Pirates discovered the truth

events.title: Roger's Ability to Hear the Voice of All Things
events.description: Rayleigh reveals that Roger possessed a unique ability to 'hear the voice of all things,' which allowed him to understand the Poneglyphs without being able to read them like Robin can. This power is different from the scholarly knowledge of Ohara.
events.significance: This reveals a mysterious power that Roger possessed, connecting it to Luffy who has shown similar abilities. It establishes that there are different ways to understand the ancient language beyond scholarship.

quotes.text: Roger couldn't read the Poneglyphs like you. He could hear the voice of all things.
quotes.speaker: Rayleigh

events.title: Robin Refuses to Learn the Truth from Rayleigh
events.description: When Rayleigh offers to tell Robin everything the Roger Pirates learned about the Void Century, Robin politely declines. She decides that she wants to discover the truth herself through her journey with the Straw Hat Pirates, as finding different answers might be possible.
events.significance: This demonstrates Robin's character growth and her commitment to the Straw Hats. It also preserves the central mystery of the series while confirming that the truth exists and can be found.

quotes.text: No, thank you. I want to learn the truth with my own eyes, through my journey with my friends.
quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin declines Rayleigh's offer to reveal the truth

events.title: Luffy Threatens to Quit if Anyone Asks About One Piece
events.description: When Usopp starts to ask Rayleigh about the location of One Piece, Luffy forcefully interrupts him. Luffy declares that if anyone tells him where the treasure is or if the adventure ends, he will quit being a pirate, emphasizing that the journey and discovery are what matter to him.
events.significance: This powerful moment defines Luffy's philosophy as a pirate and shows his commitment to earning his achievements through adventure rather than shortcuts. It parallels Roger's own spirit.

quotes.text: I don't want to know where the treasure is! I don't even want to know if there is any treasure! If you tell me anything, I'll quit being a pirate!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy stops Usopp from asking about One Piece

events.title: Brook's Unique Historical Perspective
events.description: During the conversation about Roger, Brook casually refers to Gol D. Roger as a 'rookie,' demonstrating that he is the only Straw Hat who was alive before Roger became the Pirate King and can speak about that era from personal experience.
events.significance: This moment highlights Brook's unique position as someone who lived through multiple eras of piracy and provides a different perspective on legendary figures that other characters view as purely historical.

quotes.text: Oh yes, I remember hearing about a rookie named Roger back in my day.
quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook casually mentions Roger as a contemporary

events.title: Rayleigh Offers to Coat the Thousand Sunny for Free
events.description: Rayleigh offers to coat the Thousand Sunny's hull for free as a favor to the Straw Hats, explaining that the process will take three days. He also provides each crew member with a Vivre Card so they can reunite after separating for safety.
events.significance: This establishes Rayleigh as a mentor and benefactor to the Straw Hats, setting up the coating plot and the eventual separation of the crew. The Vivre Cards become crucial for the post-Sabaody storyline.

themes.description: The episode explores how Roger's dream and actions created a lasting legacy that continues to inspire the next generation of pirates, particularly Luffy.
themes.symbolism: Rayleigh serving as a bridge between Roger's era and Luffy's generation symbolizes the passing down of the pirate spirit and will.

themes.description: Luffy's refusal to learn about One Piece's location and Robin's decision to discover the truth herself emphasize that the journey and personal discovery are more important than shortcuts to knowledge or treasure.
themes.symbolism: The three-day coating period represents the necessary preparation and patience required for great adventures.

themes.description: The episode reveals that official history (Roger being captured) differs from the truth (Roger surrendering), and suggests that different people might reach different conclusions even when examining the same historical facts.
themes.symbolism: The Poneglyphs represent hidden truths that can be understood through different means - scholarship (Robin) or innate ability (Roger).

characterSpotlights.role: Central focus as narrator of Roger's history
characterSpotlights.development: Rayleigh is revealed as not just a legendary pirate but a wise mentor figure who understands the importance of letting the new generation find their own path.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands Kizaru's arrival scene with additional animation and impact shots showing the pirates' fear.
Additional reaction shots of the Straw Hats during Rayleigh's revelations were added for dramatic effect.

trivia.fact: Episode 400 is a milestone episode and features one of the highest IMDb ratings (9.4/10) for the series, reflecting its importance to the overall story.
This episode marks the full reveal of Gol D. Roger's face and character design, which had been partially obscured or only shown in silhouette in previous appearances.
The Japanese voice actor for Gol D. Roger, Chikao Ōtsuka, was 82 years old when this episode aired. He perfectly captured Roger's larger-than-life personality in the flashback scenes.
This episode aired on May 10, 2009, and achieved a TV rating of 10.4%, ranking #4 for that week in Japan.
Brook calling Roger a 'rookie' makes him the only Straw Hat crew member who can speak about the Pirate King's era from personal experience, as he is over 90 years old.
